segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading right beneath her feet, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the wobbly stool, reaching for cookies like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, waiting so patiently, her hand outstretched like a little bird.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should turn around before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, almost mocking the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get away with it or if the stool will tip first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting, but I know it won’t do any good.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is practically begging to be emptied, and the kids are happy to oblige.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks from the outside.
segments.speaker: PAR
